results.title: The Rink
results.brief_description: A Sunday afternoon at the community skating rink in the park. Rhythmic music from a load speaker urges everyone to strike out boldly on his won, even the toddler. Girls pair off to flash their skates in the wig-wag movement of the twist, and past them speed boys in gay hockey sweaters. Without words, the film conveys the relaxed zest of a bright winter day.

results.title: The Ring within [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Eric Michel, ONF | NFB and Dan Bigras
results.brief_description: Dan Bigras, Canadian singer and filmmaker, features in his own documentary along with his extreme fighter friends, Charles Ali Nestor (27 y.o.), David Loiseau (21 y.o.) and Steve Vigneault (22 y.o.) to demonstrate that an outlet can be found for those who find themselves battling with self-destructive impulses or overwhelming uncontrollable anger and rage. Where Bigras uses singing and song-writing as his outlet, his friends prefer to channel their energies into martial arts and extreme fighting as a way of rebuilding their lives. It would seem a common thread runs through the lives of each of these young men as they tell their stories of an unhappy childhood, bullying, teenage gangs, violence and family break-down. But the frankness and honesty in their personal tales and the friendship, loyalty and support between the four men in their collective struggle to transform their anger into a rage for life is what really defines this film, not the fighting scenes - their courage is to be admired. Features interviews with families, friends, sporting personnel and other extreme fighters and includes graphic coverage of bouts from competition fights and training sessions. In English and French with English subtitles. WARNING: CONTAINS GRAPHIC IMAGES OF EXTREME FIGHT SCENES.

results.title: The Right whale: an endangered species
results.brief_description: Zoologist Roger Payne, on location in Argentina, discusses the characteristics of the Southern Right Whale, rarest of the great whales, including their feeding and communication habits.

results.title: The Right Track
results.brief_description: A safety film dedicated to teaching youngsters of the need for safety precautions in the vicinity of railroad tracks, property and and yards. Trains fascinate children, but rail tracks are a most dangerous playground. Sponsored by the Association of American Railroads.

results.title: The Right to die
results.brief_description: This film approaches the subject of death in an open manner. The questions which face today’s terminally ill - mercy killing, suicide and medical prolongation of life are scrupulously examined. Frank discussions with patients and interviews with doctors, lawyers, psychiatrists and members of the clergy provide insight and vast differences of opinions to the issues. Important concepts addressed include: when is a person alive or dead; quantity and quality of life; truth and death; criminality in mercy killing; passive versus active euthanasia.

results.title: The Right to choose
results.creator_credit: Wessex Film and Video Productions and Rouk Humphreys
results.brief_description: Begins with a reminder of how the sponsor began its work following the sudden spread of poliomyelitis in the early 1950s, and shows how it is possible for adults to learn to ride despite physical disabilities including cerebral palsy, hemiplegia, paraplegia, amputation and blindness. Intended for people whose work brings them into contact with the medical rehabilitation of the physically disabled.

results.title: The Right line
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions, David Cobham and Noel Cunningham Reid
results.brief_description: To attain championship class in motor-cycle racing, the enthusiast gains experience in many aspects of the sport, ranging from rough country scrambles to international Grand Prix. Points out The right line for keen motor-cyclists to follow and shows many exciting events taking place. Highlights include the 1960 Junior TT race in the Isle of Man, and the 1960 German Grand Prix won by Gary Hocking from Bulawayo.

results.title: The Right instrument?
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Gerald Hendrie talks about authenticity of text and performance in music and illustrates his argument with performances of Bach’s and Handel’s music on clavichord, harpsichord, piano, 17th century organ and “romantic” organ.

results.title: The Right ingredients
results.creator_credit: Australian Bicentennial Authority, Department of Sport and Recreation, Arts Victoria, Victoria. Ministry of Education, Australian Film Commission, George Cass and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: A look behind the scenes of the Australian Ballet School and the preparations of blocking the dancers in the classroom to the final performance. We see students rehearsing and dancing to the modern ballet “Signatures” and the classical ballet “The Nutcracker”. Contains commentary from Dame Margaret Scott and Kevin Coe.
